name: Courtyard Panama Multiplaza

reviews.text: We had been to the Panama Courtyard twice and both times we have had a great experience. The hotel is very nice, the lobby is very modern and the bar is also very nice.
reviews.title: Been there twice and had a great experience

reviews.text: As with all Courtyards there is no actual restaurant, but that is not a problem in this particular hotel because the hotel is basically connected to the Multiplaza Shopping mall where you can find as many choices as you can imagine for a nice lunch or dinner.
reviews.title: Great central location for stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you go to panama and are planning some shopping this is the place to stay. One thing to keep in mind is that as of the end of 2012 there was a construction adjacent to the hotel and the noise from that construction might bother some part of the hotel.
reviews.title: Great start and end to our tour

reviews.text: stayed for a total of 4 nights before and after a caravan trip. Nice. Decent mall attached with restaurants and grocery store.
reviews.title: Pleasant Hotel Experience

reviews.text: nice breakfast buffet included. Service in restaurant ok.
reviews.title: Lovely facility and helpful staff

reviews.title: Fairly typical Courtyard

reviews.text: The room rate seemed a bit overpriced. Not sure if it is a US$180 a night place, maybe closer to US$150 a night (when you get two rooms for three nights it does make a difference!).

reviews.title: Good Choice

reviews.text: Having the Multiplaza mall next door was very nice. Just a short walk to a pharmacy and grocery store. We would stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel Next to Mall

reviews.text: This is a nice Hotel just steps away from a beautiful modern Mall. Panama City is a mess right now with major Construction everywhere therfore it takes forever to get anywhere in this interesting City.
reviews.title: Shop & Stop

reviews.text: Panama City is a shocker, even for someone who lives in New York. Skyscrapers are shooting up like grass, and wealth is pouring in from nearly every South American country (best not to question the source). In the midst of this financial expansion, the Courtyard Panama Multiplaza appears almost like a shy teenager huddled at the edge of the dance floor. The hotel clings to the side of a vast, surprisingly upscale shopping mall, which features many of the stores you would expect to see at a mall in the U.S., and a few luxury names that you would not expect, like Tiffany and Cartier.
reviews.title: Four Night Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would you travel all the way to Panama City to go to a shopping mall? If the answer is yes, then this hotel may be for you. But if you're going to Panama for any other purpose (like to see the Canal), I am pretty sure you can find a better property. The hotel is relatively small, with a cramped and not very inviting lobby. The rooms are pleasantly appointed, but completely unmemorable. The first room offered to us smelled horribly of mold; the desk explained that this was a result of a problem the hotel was having with its central air conditioning system. With genuine concern and apologies, the desk manager moved us to another room that was fresh and clean. Sure enough, the room was not connected to the central air system; sadly, however, the through-the-wall unit was extremely noisy and prevented my wife and me from gaining much rest.
reviews.title: A nice stay in a more than nice hotel

reviews.text: We were part of Caravan Tour. Food was ok, but lacked variety.
reviews.title: So-So

reviews.text: Ice Machines did not have scoop--so I saw people use their hands--ugh. Not sanitary.
reviews.title: Convenient hotel in Panama City

reviews.text: I know that I am in a different country, but those are my observations.
reviews.title: Located next to multiplaza mall

reviews.text: Stayed at the Marriott Courtyard over the 4th of July weekend.
reviews.title: Great location, brand new.

reviews.text: Check-in was friendly. Room was available prior to the check-in time. Rooms are large and comfortable. Two large beds, flat screen TV, complimentary wifi or wired connection, mini fridge, iron and ironing board, and safe, great air conditioning. Bathroom was large and very clean, great shower. A buffet breakfast is served for an additional price, around $13.00. There is also a self service laundry available. The hotel is just steps from the Multiplaza Mall, and for personal goodies, food etc there is a huge grocery store connected to the mall.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Full marks:1.shampoo arrived about 60 seconds after our call. 2. The maintenance man arrived 60 seconds later to fix the light 3. On discovery that the President 's restaurant was full, Anick on the desk found an excellent restaurant, Alkimia, and arranged transportation. This was a one night stopover, and was just right for that. Excellent shopping mall next door
reviews.title: Efficient

reviews.text: Enjoyed our one night here before our flight home to the States the next morning. The hotel is very modern and in excellent condition. Appears to be a relatively new hotel. It is connected to the mall which is nice for dining options! However almost everybody speaks Spanish, very hard to find somebody that spoke English in the mall. The hotel was great and plenty of bi-lingual speakers there. Overall great stay and would definitely recommend the hotel to others!
reviews.title: Overall Great Stay!!

reviews.text: This hotel is located in the city away from the skyscrapers and the downtown traffic even though it is easily accessible. This being my first time in Panama City, I found the hotel staff very hospitable and provided all services expected from Courtyard Marriott.
reviews.title: Convenient, Clean and Friendly

reviews.text: The rooms are large, comfortable and clean. I had a room on the second floor and it was particularly convenient to access the meeting rooms and the restaurant.
reviews.title: Didn't meet my expectations

reviews.text: Hotel is nicely priced, so no complaints there. However, I am not planning to return.
reviews.title: Not worth it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A/C in the room was very loud, kept me awake the first night, but it was too hot to turn it off. During the week I stayed the carpet under the A/C unit got wetter and wetter. Halfway through the week I started spreading newspapers on the floor to soak up the moisture. Housekeeping did not pick them up each day, for some odd reason. I heard from people who have stayed in the hotel before that they had the same issue with the carpet. As a result the room had an unpleasant damp smell.
reviews.title: Good Location-Decent Hotel

reviews.text: Breakfast was OK. The staff kept speaking Spanish to me even though I clearly was not understanding.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings

reviews.text: The gym only had one sad mat for streching and yoga. Treadmills kept stopping. But there were plenty of towels and the gym certainly was not crowded.
reviews.title: Fresh and Bright - a great place to stay

reviews.text: The mall next door is convenient and gives plenty of eating options at the food court. The stores are expensive though. Taxi drivers were totally taking an advantage of the tourist, it did not matter whether I took the taxi from the hotel or the mall, I got overcharged both times.
reviews.title: A hidden gem!

description: Located at the heart of the entertainment and business center of Panama City. Within Multiplaza shopping and entertainment complex, the most vibrant shopping mall and entertainment center in Panama City. With more than 280 shopping stores, a variety of restaurants, movie theaters and more. Considered the best location in Panama City, quick access to many restaurants, convention centers, Punta Pacifica Hospital and business areas including: Costa del Este Business Park, Torre las Americas and only 15 minutes from Tocumen International Airport.Our hotel combines the newest technologies with the convenience of room service, Sushi bar and coffee shop. 248 guestrooms totally equipped with 32" LCD TVs, free Wired & Wi-Fi internet with streaming speed (40MB), 24hrs business center and soundproof windows.Our three meal restaurant Pacific Grill, offers an affordable daily buffet breakfast, lunch and dinner. The Panama Canal, Causeway of Amador, casco antiguo and many other attractions are at your fingertips when staying with us.
